resources.string: Press the Floating Button below, then place the tip of your finger on the camera lens to Begin

"Start Your Measurement.

"
"Instant Heart Rate measures your heart rate by analyzing color changes on the tip of your finger.

"
"Gently place the tip of your finger on the camera so it completely covers the lens. " "It is not necessary to cover the flash. Hold your phone steady. 

"
"Heart Rate Zones.

"
"Heart Rate is the number of heart beats per unit of time, typically expressed as " "beat per minutes (bpm).

"
"Warm Up.

"
"132bpm - 144bpm " "50-60% of heart rate reserve " "This zone is the least intense. You are in it just to warm up or cool down, " "in order to prevent injuries.

"
"Fat Burn.

"
"144 - 156bpm " "60 - 70% of heart rate reserve.
" "Stay in this zone if your goal is to lose weight. Your body is fueled by 10% " "carbohydrates, 5% protein and 85% fat.
" "The actual number of calories burned per minute will be less than in higher zones, " "but you'll be able to maintain exercise longer.

"
"Cardio.

"
"156bpm - 168bpm 
" "70 - 80% of heart rate reserve 
" "Also called anaerobic zone. In this you'll get the greatest health benefits overall. " "Your heart and lung capacity will increase and your overall fitness will also increase, " "so you'll be able to exercise longer. Your body will get 50% of your calories from fat, " "50% from carbohydrates and protein burn will be minimal.

"
"Extreme.

" "168bpm - 180bpm 
" "80 - 90% of heart rate reserve 
"
"Also called anaerobic zone. This is highly intense exercise and should be limited to no " "more than 10-20 minutes. Your body's ability to consume oxygen will increase. 
" "If you push too hard your body will start producing lactic acid. Your body will burn 85% " "fats and minimal percentage of protein.

"
"Max.

"
"180bpm - 192bpm 
" "You are pushing your heart to the limits here and should consult your doctor to check " "if you can exercise in this zone safely. 

"
"Heart rate zones in this app are calculated using Detection Algorithm .

"
